thread.title: Antonio Conte has his say on the Ander Herrera red card and looks ahead at FA Cup semi-final against Tottenham
thread.title_full: Antonio Conte has his say on the Ander Herrera red card and looks ahead at FA Cup semi-final against Tottenham

author: Jake Polden
title: Antonio Conte has his say on the Ander Herrera red card and looks ahead at FA Cup semi-final against Tottenham
text:
Get Chelsea FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Antonio Conte hailed his Chelsea side after their FA Cup win over Manchester United in the quarter-final of the FA Cup. 
The Italian called Jose Mourinho's Red Devils "the best squad in the Premier League" and said his side have to be pleased with the 1-0 victory. 
N'Golo Kante's 51st minute strike made the difference on Monday night, but it could have been another story had Ander Herrera not been shown red in the first half. 
United, who started the game brightly, were reduced to ten men on 35 minutes when the Spaniard picked up two yellow cards. Antonio Conte hailed his Chelsea side after their FA Cup win (Photo: REUTERS) Ander Herrera is shown a red card by referee Michael Oliver at Stamford Bridge (Photo: Julian Finney) 
Mourinho refused to discuss the sending off after the game, but Conte suggested referee Michael Oliver made the correct call. 
Praising his side's performance on the BBC, the Italian said: "For sure a good performance against a team who are very strong with good players. 
"For me United have the best squad in the league, a lot of good players and for us we must be pleased to go into the next round, and to have beaten a great opponent." 
When asked for his thoughts on Herrera's red card, Conte added: "I think [Eden] Hazard started the game and he couldn't play football. 
"People [can] look at this and then judge the situation." Chelsea's N'Golo Kante celebrates scoring in the 1-0 win over Man United (Photo: REUTERS) Chelsea will now play Tottenham in the semi-final of the FA Cup (Photo: PA) 
Chelsea will play Tottenham in the semi-final of the FA Cup, three months after the north London side beat them 2-0 at White Hate Lane. 
Speaking ahead of the derby, Conte said: "It's difficult but also in this quarter-final it was the same, very difficult against United. 
"Now we go to Wembley to play against Tottenham, a top team, but for now we must be satisfied for what we are doing this season." poll loading Will Chelsea win the Double this year? 500+ VOTES SO FAR
